globals.banner_text: Source: U.S. Census Bureau, Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates.

content.text: Note: Statistics for ages under 5 years are available only at the state level.

Note: In some states, separate school districts for elementary and secondary schools may cover the same geographic area. Districts that encompass the full range of grades are refered to here as "unified".
Note: You can select items on the map and then look at just those entities on the Table or Trend pages. Use the area selector tool on the toolbar and drag around the areas you wish to select.

Note: You can sort columns by clicking the header. Click again to sort in the other direction. The "Map" link in the last column will open another page with the district boundary map from American FactFinder.
Note: You can sort columns by clicking the header. Click again to sort in the other direction.

Note: Click on a name to gray out other lines, and see just that line in context. Confidence intervals are not available for school district estimates, but you can see them for states and the US by hovering over the names in the legend.

Note: You can see the confidence interval for US, state or county estimates by hovering over the names in the legend. You can click on a name to gray out other lines, so you can see just that line in context.

text.default: Sorry, you need to select no more than !M! entities; currently there are !S! selected. You can use the map or the buttons on the left to make selections.
